snippet: Two senior officials cautioned that final confirmation about the object found on a remote French island could come only from the French or Malaysian authorities.
abstract: Australian officials express confidence that debris found on French island of Reunion near Madagascar is from Malaysia Airlines Flight 370, which disappeared in 2014; say photographs may contain enough detail to make identification without physical examination of debris.

byline.original: By MICHELLE INNIS and AURELIEN BREEDEN
byline.contributor: Aurelien Breeden contributed reporting from Paris, and Christopher Drew from New York.

lead_paragraph: Two senior officials cautioned that final confirmation about the object found on a remote French island could come only from the French or Malaysian authorities.

headline.main: Plane Debris Is Probably From Flight 370, Australians Say
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Australia; Photos Could Link Debris to Flight 370
